description: Standing Offer Agreement of Consultant Services for pre-design report, preparation of statement of requirements or construction requirements, option analysis etc.

full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Consultant Services in Engineering

**Tender ID:** MX-43020818163

**Title:** Consultant Services in Engineering

**Publish Date:** January 30, 2024

**Closing Date:** March 8, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST

**Title-Titre:** French Translation

[SN992302, Services d'expert-conseil en ingénierie AOP]

**Contracting Entity:** Defence Construction Canada

**Procurement Category:** Service

**Notice Type:** Government Contract

**Notice Type-Avis Type French:** Avis public

The Government of Canada, through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), is seeking proposals from consulting firms to award a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) for the provision of engineering consultant services. The selected contractor will provide "as and when required" professional services in support of the following projects:

* Pre-design report
* Preparation of construction documents or performance specification
* Option analysis
* Concept studies
* Life cycle cost analysis including climate change impacts
* Cost estimates
* Design and development
* Services during the bidding phase
* Services during the construction phase

## Important Dates

- **Solicitation Number Numéro de Mise En Concorrence:** SN 992302
- **Publication Date Date de Publication:** January 30, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date Date Clôture du Marché:** March 8, 2024 at 2:00 PM EST
- **Amendment Date Date de Modification:** March 8, 2024
- **Procurement Status Statut du Processus d'approvisionnement:** Expiré
- **Notice URL URL du Avis:** [https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2783877007/abstract?language=EN](https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2783877007/abstract?language=EN) and [https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2783877007/abstract?language=FR](https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2783877007/abstract?language=FR)

## Solicitation and Evaluation Criteria

The solicitation and evaluation of proposals will be conducted in accordance with the requirements of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
